description: Also known as the Island of Courage and Sorrow, this poignant memorial on a small island in the Svislach River honors 771 Belarusian soldiers who died in the Soviet-Afghan War (1979-1989). The centerpiece is a tiny chapel surrounded by towering statues of grieving mothers and sisters, creating one of Minsk's most emotionally powerful sites.
highlights: Dedicated to 771 Belarusian soldiers killed in Afghanistan 1979-1989
Central chapel with four entrances and four altars
Names of all 771 fallen soldiers carved on altars
Towering statues of sorrowful mothers and sisters
Weeping angel statue unable to protect soldiers
Mothers holding lamps symbolizing family warmth and hope
Boulders with names of Afghan provinces where Soviets fought
Icon of Mother of God on large boulder
Picturesque location on Svislach River island
tips: Accessed via footbridge from Ulitsa Starovilenskaya
Located in historic Trinity district near Trinity Suburb
Best visited during spring and fall for mild weather
Emotionally heavy - allow time for reflection
Popular with locals honoring fallen family members
Combine with Trinity Suburb visit nearby
vibe: Heartbreaking, contemplative, profoundly moving - a sacred space where maternal grief is frozen in stone, evoking universal sorrow for lives lost in war
